page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO FENLAND
page.content: Our region includes the northern parts of{Leverington}and{Gorefield, Fitton {End}and much of the village of{Newton. It is essentially a{flat farming}area, lying to the North-West of{Wisbech. The land is mainly rich,{fertile {fenland}silt and a wide range of {agricultural}and{horticultural}crops are grown.Situated on the drier side of the country, with a moderate rainfall and a good sunshine record, the air is clean and bracing with sea breezes from The Wash.Although much of the work-force now concentrates on the light industries offered in and around Wisbech,the community still retains its strong links with the land,by virtue of casual{fruit-picking}and numerous allotments.Despite the lack of scenic beauty,the region still has plenty to offer.
